theorem interior_union_right_open {X : Type*} [TopologicalSpace X] {A B : Set X}
    (hB : IsOpen B) :
    interior (A ∪ B) = interior A ∪ B := by
  apply Set.Subset.antisymm
  · -- `interior (A ∪ B) ⊆ interior A ∪ B`
    intro x hx
    by_cases hxB : x ∈ B
    · exact Or.inr hxB
    · -- If `x ∉ B`, we will show `x ∈ interior A`.
      -- Obtain an open neighbourhood `U` of `x` contained in `A ∪ B`.
      rcases mem_interior_iff_mem_nhds.1 hx with ⟨U, hUopen, hxU, hUsub⟩
      -- Consider the open set `V = U \ B` that contains `x` and is contained in `A`.
      have hVopen : IsOpen (U \ B) := hUopen.diff hB
      have hxV : x ∈ U \ B := ⟨hxU, hxB⟩
      have hVsubA : (U \ B : Set X) ⊆ A := by
        intro y hy
        have hYinUnion : y ∈ A ∪ B := hUsub hy.1
        cases hYinUnion with
        | inl hAy => exact hAy
        | inr hBy => exact (hy.2 hBy).elim
      -- Hence `x ∈ interior A`.
      have hxIntA : x ∈ interior A :=
        (interior_maximal hVsubA hVopen) hxV
      exact Or.inl hxIntA
  · -- `interior A ∪ B ⊆ interior (A ∪ B)`
    intro x hx
    cases hx with
    | inl hxIntA =>
        -- `interior A` is contained in `interior (A ∪ B)` by monotonicity.
        have hsubset : interior A ⊆ interior (A ∪ B) :=
          interior_mono (Set.subset_union_left : (A : Set X) ⊆ A ∪ B)
        exact hsubset hxIntA
    | inr hxB =>
        -- `B` is open and contained in `A ∪ B`, hence in the interior.
        have hBsubset : (B : Set X) ⊆ interior (A ∪ B) :=
          interior_maximal
            (by
              intro y hy
              exact Or.inr hy)
            hB
        exact hBsubset hxB

theorem P3_iUnion_open {X ι : Type*} [TopologicalSpace X] {A : ι → Set X}
    (hA : ∀ i, IsOpen (A i)) :
    Topology.P3 (⋃ i, A i) := by
  -- Each `A i` is open and hence satisfies `P3`.
  have hP3 : ∀ i, Topology.P3 (A i) := fun i => Topology.P3_of_open (A := A i) (hA i)
  exact Topology.P3_iUnion hP3
